qas.question: In 1922, which estate sold The Times?
The Times gained much notoriety in the 1930s because of its advocacy of what?
Which The Times editor was closely allied with the government who practised German appeasement?
Which notable government official did The Times ally with in the 1930s whom practised German appeasement?

context: In 1922, <a0_0>John Jacob Astor<a0_0/>, son of the 1st Viscount Astor, bought The Times from the <a1_0>Northcliffe estate<a1_0/>. The paper gained a measure of notoriety in the 1930s with its advocacy of <a2_0>German appeasement<a2_0/>; then-editor <a3_0>Geoffrey Dawson<a3_0/> was closely allied with those in the government who practised appeasement, most notably <a4_0>Neville Chamberlain<a4_0/>.
